content:
DataGridViewSelectedRowCollection Class

In this Article

Represents a collection of DataGridViewRow objects that are selected in a DataGridView.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.ListBindable(false)]
public class DataGridViewSelectedRowCollection : System.Windows.Forms.BaseCollection, System.Collections.IList

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • MarshalByRefObject
  • System.Windows.Forms.BaseCollection
  • DataGridViewSelectedRowCollection

Inherited Members

Remarks

The order of rows in the collection is not guaranteed to match the order in which they were selected.

Properties summary

Item(Int32)

Gets the row at the specified index.
List

Gets the list of elements contained in the BaseCollection instance.

Methods summary

Clear()

Clears the collection.
Contains(DataGridViewRow)

Determines whether the specified row is contained in the collection.
CopyTo(DataGridViewRow[],Int32)

Copies the elements of the collection to the specified array, starting at the specified index.
Insert(Int32,DataGridViewRow)

Inserts a row into the collection at the specified position.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

Copies the elements of the collection to the specified array, starting at the specified index.

Gets the number of elements in the collection.

Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.

Implements the stem.Collections.IList.Add* method. Always throws NotSupportedException.

Implements the stem.Collections.IList.Clear* method. Always throws NotSupportedException.

Determines whether the specified value is contained in the collection.
IList.IndexOf(Object)

Returns the index of the specified element.
IList.Insert(Int32,Object)

Implements the stem.Collections.IList.Insert* method. Always throws NotSupportedException.
IList.IsFixedSize

Gets a value indicating whether the collection has a fixed size.
IList.IsReadOnly

Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.

Gets the element at the specified index.

Implements the stem.Collections.IList.Remove* method. Always throws NotSupportedException.

Implements the stem.Collections.IList.RemoveAt* method. Always throws NotSupportedException.

Properties

  • Item(Int32)

    Gets the row at the specified index.

    public System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow this[int index] { get; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index of the DataGridViewRow in the DataGridViewSelectedRowCollection.

    Property Value

    • DataGridViewRow

      The DataGridViewRow at the current index.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than 0.

      -or-

      index is equal to or greater than the number of rows in the collection.

  • List

    Gets the list of elements contained in the BaseCollection instance.

    protected override System.Collections.ArrayList List { get; }

    Property Value

    • ArrayList

      An ArrayList containing the elements of the collection. This property returns null unless overridden in a derived class.

Methods

  • Clear()

    Clears the collection.

    public void Clear ();

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      Always thrown.

    Remarks

    This method is not relevant for this class. You cannot change the DataGridViewSelectedRowCollection class directly. To clear the DataGridViewSelectedRowCollection, use the ClearSelection method.

  • Contains(DataGridViewRow)

    Determines whether the specified row is contained in the collection.

    public bool Contains (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow dataGridViewRow);

    Parameters

    • dataGridViewRow
      DataGridViewRow

      The DataGridViewRow to locate in the DataGridViewSelectedRowCollection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if dataGridViewRow is in the collection; otherwise, false.

  • CopyTo(DataGridViewRow[],Int32)

    Copies the elements of the collection to the specified array, starting at the specified index.

    public void CopyTo (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow[] array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      DataGridViewRow[]

      The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection. The array must have zero-based indexing.

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      array is null.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than zero.

    • ArgumentException

      array is multidimensional.

      -or-

      The number of elements in the DataGridViewCellCollection is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.

    • InvalidCastException

      The DataGridViewCellCollection cannot be cast automatically to the type of array.

  • Insert(Int32,DataGridViewRow)

    Inserts a row into the collection at the specified position.

    public void Insert (int index, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow dataGridViewRow);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index at which dataGridViewRow should be inserted.

    • dataGridViewRow
      DataGridViewRow

      The DataGridViewRow to insert into the DataGridViewSelectedRowCollection.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      Always thrown.

    Remarks

    This method is not relevant for this class. You cannot change the DataGridViewSelectedRowCollection class directly. To insert a row into the DataGridViewSelectedRowCollection, use the Selected property.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • ICollection.CopyTo(Array,Int32)

    Copies the elements of the collection to the specified array, starting at the specified index.

    void ICollection.CopyTo (Array array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      Array

      The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection. The array must have zero-based indexing.

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      array is null.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than zero.

    • ArgumentException

      array is multidimensional.

      -or-

      The number of elements in the DataGridViewCellCollection is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.

    • InvalidCastException

      The DataGridViewCellCollection cannot be cast automatically to the type of array.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DataGridViewSelectedRowCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.
